Find Systesm that a User has Access to

  1. To identify the servers that a user has access to the run the following script Example /usr/local/scripts/where-is-waldo.sh x1cxs952 
     /usr/local/scripts/where-is-waldo.sh {user id you are looking for}
  1. This will create a file in /tmp with the name Found-WALDO-{user id} Example /tmp/Found-WALDO-x1cxs952. Use the editor of your choice to open the file. There will be a paragraph for each server. Scroll through the list and you will esee the servers where the user has access. This will also work for multiple users and will produce a seprerate file in /tmp for each user requested. Example /usr/local/scripts/where-is-waldo.sh x1cxs952 x1kxk630 and so on.
